page.title: 05Twyning Manor
page.content: {Twyning Manor}is a victorian building standing in its own grounds of approx. 5 acres. About 12 years ago the Manor was sold to a builder after it had been vaccant for some time. The builder gutted the interior but retained the external building and converted it into 13 flats and maisonettes.3 of these are maisonettes having their own front doors with two double bedrooms. The rest are in the main building and offer one or two bedroom accomodation. The residents buy their lease hold flat, and are owned by a cross section of the community. Retired couples are the main occupants, but some are owned by people who work abroad and use them as a home base. A residents association deals with maintaining the buildings and keeping the grasslands cut in the grounds.
